issue.title: 1KB â†’ 1 kB
issue.body:
[Here](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/blob/master/src/qt/locale/bitcoin_en.ts) I found a typo: see [here](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Kilobyte#cite_note-0) and [this](https://gist.github.com/1555936) patch.

Regards,
Carlo

events.body:
Ah, what do you mean with "1KB"? 1024 B? In this case, the correct unit is "1 KiB":

http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Kibibyte

Ciao!

No, it's per 1000. So kB would be right.

However, remember that you need to change the message (at least the <source> one) in _all_ the translations if you change English.
Despite SI, "KB" has traditionally been defined as 1024 bytes.
@tcatm do you know of an efficient way to update this in transifex, in one go?
I think you can tx pull, sed 's/KB/kB/', diff and tx push (tx is the tool to work with transifex).

Pay attention, there are 2 errors to be fixed:
1) KB â†’ kB
2) the blank to be added between the number and the unit (e.g. "1 kB")
